pull.title: fuzz: Fill various small fuzzing gaps
pull.body:
Fill various small fuzzing gaps.

See [`doc/fuzzing.md`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/fuzzing.md) for information on how to fuzz Bitcoin Core. Don't forget to contribute any coverage increasing inputs you find to the [Bitcoin Core fuzzing corpus repo](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/qa-assets).

Happy fuzzing :)

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
No conflicts as of last run.

events.message: fuzz: Fill various small fuzzing gaps

events.body: @MarcoFalke Thanks for reviewing. Feedback addressed. Please re-review :)

events.message: fuzz: Add coverage for CDataStream consumer

events.body: Feedback addressed. Should hopefully be ready for final review :)

comments.body: I don't really like re-using the same seed for different serialization formats. I think it would be better to have separate targets (and folders) for this
would be nice to introduce an `ALL_FEE_EST_HORIZON` constexpr

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,37 @@
+// Copyright (c) 2020 The Bitcoin Core developers

+// file COPYING or http://www.opensource.org/licenses/mit-license.php.
+
+#include <addrman.h>
+#include <net.h>
+#include <test/fuzz/FuzzedDataProvider.h>
+#include <test/fuzz/fuzz.h>
+#include <test/fuzz/util.h>
+
+#include <cstdint>
+#include <vector>
+
+void initialize_data_stream()
+{
+    InitializeFuzzingContext();
+}
+
+FUZZ_TARGET_INIT(data_stream, initialize_data_stream)

@@ -0,0 +1,37 @@

+#include <test/fuzz/fuzz.h>
+#include <test/fuzz/util.h>

+{

+}
+
+FUZZ_TARGET_INIT(data_stream, initialize_data_stream)

comments.body: Can you explain why it is required to boot up a full node to call a single constructor that only invokes `std::move`. Maybe the whole fuzz test isn't particularly useful, when it only calls `std::move`, which is already covered by other fuzz targets: https://marcofalke.github.io/btc_cov/fuzz.coverage/src/net.h.gcov.html#745
